properties.name: Bethlehem, Israel
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickBethlehem, IsraelBethlehem has four museums located within its municipal borders. The Crib of the Nativity Theatre and Museum offers visitors 31 3D models depicting the significant stages of the life of Jesus. There is also The Badd Giacaman Museum, which is located in the Old City of Bethlehem, which dates back to the 18th century and is mainly dedicated to the history and process of olive oil production. The Baituna al-Talhami Museum, another museum in Bethlehem was established in 1972, containing displays of the culture of Bethlehem\'s inhabitants.[3] The International Museum of Nativity was designed by United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) mosthly for the purpose of showing works of "high artistic quality".

properties.name: Columbine, Colorado
properties.description: Posted by Fliprchickcolumbine, coloradoColumbine High School opened in the fall of 1973 in Columbine Colorado. The school was so small that the first year it opened it didn\'t even have a graduating class. The first graduating class for the school was in 1975. Most people know Columbing High School from a school shooting that took place on April 20, 1999.Two students (Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold) killed 12 students one teacher and wounded 24 others and also took their own lives. Columbine High Shool shooting was the 4th deadliest school shooting in United States history.

properties.name: Foz de Iguacu, Brazil
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickFoz de IguacuNearly four times wider and slightly taller than Niagara Falls, Iguaçú Falls is located at the confluence of three major South American countries - Brazil, Argentina and Paraguay. The park shares with Iguazú National Park in Argentina one of the world’s largest and most impressive waterfalls, extending over some 2,700 m. It is home to many rare and endangered species of flora and fauna, among them the giant otter and the giant anteater. The clouds of spray produced by the waterfall are conducive to the growth of lush vegetation.

properties.name: Kennedy Space Center
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickFlOn July 29, 1958, President Dwight D. Eisenhower signed Public Law, creating the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, or NASA. In July 1962, the agency established its Launch Operations Center on Florida\'s east coast, and renamed it in 1963 to honor John F. Kennedy who helped put America on the path to the moon, and all the other space projects that have made the United States the space foward country that it is today.

properties.name: Kitty Hwak, NC
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickKitty Hawk, NCKitty Hawk, North Carolina was a small town in Dare County that was established in the 1700s. It was made famous on December 17,1903, when the Wright brothers made the first controlled, powered airplane flights four miles away near the sand dunes or the Kill Devil Hills. The Wright brothers returned to their hometown of Dayton, Ohio many airplane testings became active throught the Huffman Prairies during 1904 and 1905

properties.name: New York City
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickNew York City, NYNew York City is the offical city of New York. It is the most populous city in the United States and one of the largest in the world. N.Y.C. (as it is more commonly known as) has been one of the world\'s major centers of commerce and finance for over a hundred years. New York is the most dinsely populated city in the country, having 8.2 million residents within a 332 square mile radius. The five main sections in N.Y.C. are Brooklyn, The Bronx, Queens, Manhattan, and Staten Island.

properties.name: Palestine, Israel
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickNazareth, IsraelBethlehem (which is now more commonly known as Palestine) is the birthplace of Jesus of Nazareth and the town is one of the oldest Christian communities in the world; Although the population has reduced greatly over the years due to immigration. The city is also believed to be the birthplace of David king of Isreal. Modern Bethlehem has a Muslim majority but is also home to one of the largest Palestinian Christian communities. There are several important Jewish sites located in Bethlehem such as Rachel\'s tomb (Rachel daughter Laban in The Bible)

properties.name: San Antonio, Texas
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickSan AntionioSan Antonio is the second-largest city in the the state of Texas and the seventh largest in the U.S. Located in the northern part of South Texas it was named the fouth fastest growing large city in the country in terms of percentage. Its metropolitan area has a population over 1.9 million ans as of 2006 had the 29th largest metro area in the nation.

properties.name: Sao Paulo, Brazil
properties.description: Posted by Fliprchicksao paulo, brazilSao Paulo is the largest city in Brazil and the fifth largest city in the world in population. Sao Paulo in Portuguese means Saint Paul, it is also the richest city in Brazil. This thriving city is the capitol of Brazil and is known for its unreliable weather and amazing architecture. A nickname for the city is "Sampa" and people from the city are known as paulistanos.

properties.name: Tulsa,OK
properties.description: Posted by FliprchickStillwater, OKOklahoma is second only to the state of California in the size of its Native American population. Many of the 252,420 American Indians living in the state (8 percent of population) are descended from 67 tribes who inhabited Indian Territory (what is now the state of Oklahoma). Tribal headquarters for 39 tribes are in Oklahoma. The city of Tulsa ranks second in the United States for total number of American Indian residents with 48,196. Oklahoma City ranks fourth, with 45,720 American Indian residents. (The parking meter was invented in Oklahoma City.) :)
